text: Skalds are the keepers of lore, part entertainer, part warrior, these individuals are held in high esteem for their knowledge and their sagas inspire Norscan warriors.
Skalds are the keepers of lore, the chroniclers of the histories of the Norse. Part entertainer, part warrior, these individuals are held in high esteem for their wisdom and knowledge.
[[col:yellow]]Use the Skald's Knowledge to increases the armour of all units in the parent army by %n. Only one Skald can apply this effect at a time.[[/col]]
[[col:yellow]]Use the Skald's Knowledge to increases the missile and melee damage of all units in the parent army by %n%. Only one Skald can apply this effect at a time.[[/col]]
The many saga's that the Skald orates tell tales of legendary battles and hardened warriors, their words resonate and perhaps merely perceptively - increase the damage done by the Norscan retinue.
The many saga's that the Skald orates tell tales of legendary battles and hardened warriors, their words resonate and perhaps merely perceptively - increase the effectiveness of Norscan armour.
Those in the army can find succour or be replenished by the power of this champion.
The Skald's rhythmic beats inspire courage and unity in the heart of battle.
With each beat, the Skald's drum fortifies the defenses of his allies, shielding them from harm.
The Skald's horn unleashes a primal call to arms, fueling the fury of those who hear it.
Mutually exclusive with other Skald inspiring abilities
Through ancient chants, the Skald extends the reach of his inspiring melodies, ensuring no warrior is beyond the call to battle.
Effect range: %+n% for Skald inspiring abilities
With a mighty beat, the Skald's drumming creates an impenetrable barrier around his allies, turning them into an unbreakable bulwark against the enemy's advance.
The Skald's horn summons forth a raging tempest of fury, driving allies into a berserk frenzy, and striking fear into the hearts of their enemies.
The Skald's horn summons forth a raging tempest of fury, driving allies into a berserk frenzy, and striking fear into the hearts of their enemies.
With a mighty beat, the Skald's drumming creates an impenetrable barrier around his allies, turning them into an unbreakable bulwark against the enemy's advance.
Blasts of the horn stir the fury within Norscan warriors, driving them to greater feats of strength and savagery.
Beats of the battle drummer instill an unyielding resolve in Norscan warriors, turning aside blows with relentless determination.

Skalds serve in the High King's Great Hall as chronicler, entertainer, warrior. Yet their ability to invigorate troops with knowledge over the finest brews is lesser known.

They cry out the names of wolf-born heroes — Bjarki, Svanhild, Hrothgar — and the blood remembers.
They cry out the names of wolf-born heroes — Bjarki, Svanhild, Hrothgar — and the blood remembers.

Among the Bjornling and Vanaheim tribes, the Shieldmaidens are revered as warriors of tradition — protectors of homestead, hall, and honour. While many Norsemen seek blood and glory far from their shores, these women carry the fire of their people within.
To fight is the shieldmaiden's birthright, to die without honour their only fear.

The Shieldmaidens of the north are more than myth, they are war-wrought daughters of iron, shield-sworn and spear-trained from youth. Forged by the unrelenting trials of Norscan life, they stand equal among warriors, their discipline and fury a match for any marauder or berserker. These women are not mere consorts of war, but champions of it: Guardians of clan hearths, slayers of beasts, and defenders of the longships. Whether facing the horrors of the Chaos Wastes or rival tribes, a Shieldmaiden does not break — she plants her shield and makes her stand.
They say she was born amidst crashing waves and war cries, and never once wept.
Her eyes scan the night for foes — few slip past her watch and live to boast.
Hard as permafrost and twice as unyielding, she leads without doubt or fear.
The maiden swears a binding oath, her loyalty etched deeper than steel or stone.
When she speaks, warriors listen. When she cries war, they charge.
Beneath her banner, the tide holds. Even the sea cannot break her command.
